chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Luke Kamish was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • Hit and Run-Involve Injury, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT to Counts 2 and 3 and CONCURRENT to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
No possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with the victims C.A., J.A., and S.H.
No contact with the co-defendant K.G.

supervisions.notes:
*10-20-2022 Honorable Milton L. Childs: Court orders restitution set at $10,000.00 payable to Hartford Insurance Company. Court orders restitution set at $1,801.52 payable to C.A. Court further orders any payments to be paid to victim C.A. FIRST.  Court orders Judgment of Conviction amended to reflect restitution amount.  Court further orders restitution to be paid during the term of extended supervision.  Court finds good cause to toll any time limits and schedules another restitution hearing to allow victim in Count 3 an opportunity to make a statement.
Restitution hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Restitution hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Provide DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Luke Kamish appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Luke Kamish.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a contested restitution hearing.  Sworn for the State: Dominic Fornero (Hartford Insurance Company Representative).  Court orders restitution set at $10,000.00 payable to Hartford Insurance Company.

Sworn for the State: C.A.  Court orders restitution set at $1,801.52 payable to C.A.  Court further orders any payments to be paid to victim C.A. FIRST.  

Court orders Judgment of Conviction amended to reflect restitution amount.  Court further orders restitution to be paid during the term of extended supervision.  Court finds good cause to toll any time limits and schedules another restitution hearing to allow victim in Count 3 an opportunity to make a statement.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Restitution hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Received and Filed.
Filed: Original Transcript of Sentencing P.M. (19 pages) commencing 09-02-2022 by Lisa Diamond.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Luke Kamish in court, in custody.  Attorney Ashley Fard in court for Luke Kamish.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for sentencing.  Sentencing proceeded.  Court found the State has satisfied victims' rights law. 

Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3.5 YEARS with 258 days credit, CONCURRENT to Counts 2 and 3 and CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to Counts 1 and 3 and CONCURRENT to any other sentence. 

AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3.5 YEARS with 258 days credit, CONCURRENT to Counts 1 and 2 and CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- Provide DNA sample.
- No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
- No possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with the department.
- No contact with the victims C.A., J.A., and S.H.
- No contact with the co-defendant K.G. 

Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.  Firearms and voting warnings given. 

Court scheduled a restitution hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Restitution hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Due to court congestion, Court rescheduled sentencing to September 2, 2022 at 2:00 PM in Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.  Defendant currently being held at CJF.
Letter from defendant re:  request to be produced for upcoming hearing.  (Luke Kamish - #421821, Oshkosh Correctional Institution, PO Box 3530, Oshkosh WI 54903).
Letter from defendant re:  requesting to be produced for next court hearing on 9/1/22.  (Luke Kamish - #421821, Oshkosh Correctional Institution, PO Box 3310, Oshkosh WI 54903-3310).

Defendant Luke Kamish in court with attorney Ashley Fard via zoom.  Defendant Luke Kamish in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Jury trial.    Sworn: Luke Kamish
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2 and 3:

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody for sentencing.  The case is adjourned to branch 2.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Luke Kamish in court with attorney Haily Wentz on behalf of Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Luke Kamish in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Luke Kamish appeared by video means with Attorney.
  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.
